isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION - TRACTION CONTROL WHEN VEHICLE SPEED IS 0 TO 25 MPH

svcproc.title: TRACTION CONTROL WHEN VEHICLE SPEED IS 0 TO 25 MPH
svcproc.para: When wheel spin is detected and the vehicle is stopped or moving at less than 25 mph, the controller simultaneously executes the following operations:

step1.para: The controller instantly blinks the Traction Active light on the instrument panel to advise the driver that wheel spin is occurring.

The controller uses its J1922 Data Link connection to the engine electronic control module (ECM) to send a signal causing the ECM to reduce engine torque to a level suitable for the available traction.

The controller opens and closes the solenoid valve in the appropriate modulator valve to gently pump the brake on the spinning wheel, to force the differential to drive the stationary or slowly spinning wheel.
Once wheel spin is eliminated, the controller turns the Traction Active light on the instrument panel off, and disengages control of the system.
